frame.name: Facial_expression
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame refer to facial <fen>Expression</fen>s and the <fen>Possessor</fen>s of those <fen>Expression</fen>s.
<ex><fex name="Possessor">His</fex> <fex name="Manner">lackluster</fex> <fex name="Expression"><t>smile</t></fex> <fex name="Conveyed_emotion">revealed his disappointment</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expression
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the <fen>Expression</fen> made.<ex>He gave a wide <fex name="Exp">grin</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the person who exhibitis the <fen>Expression</fen>.<ex><fex name="Poss">Ryan</fex> grinned.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Expression</fen> may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fen>Internal_cause</fen> - the <fen>Possessor</fen>'s mental or emotional state. <fen>Internal_cause</fen> is expressed in a PP Complement as in: <ex>Kim made a <t>frown</t> <fex name="ICause">in concentration</fex></ex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The part of the face saliently exhibiting the <fen>Expression</fen>.
<ex>The <t>smile</t> <fex name="Loc">on her face</fex> was repayment enough.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Conveyed_emotion
FE.definition: <def-root>The emotion that is conveyed by a particular <fen>Expression</fen>. <ex>He had an <fex name="CEmot">angry</fex> <t>expression</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Intended_perceiver
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity toward which the <fen>Expression</fen> is directed.</def-root>

FE.name: External_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of affairs perceived by the <fen>Possessor</fen> which leads to an <fen>Internal_cause</fen> (emotion, etc.) which then gives rise to the <fen>Expression</fen>.<ex>I made a <t>grimace</t> <fex name="Ext">at her clumsiness</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period of time for which the facial <fen>Expression</fen> is held.
<ex>A <fex name="Duration">brief</fex> <t>smile</t> appeared on his face</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: smile.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of smiling; a smiling expression

lexUnit.name: grimace.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ugly, twisted expression on a person's face, typically expressing disgust, pain, or wry amusement.

lexUnit.name: grin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a smile or grimace produced by grinning

lexUnit.name: frown.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: [verb] furrow one's brows in an expression indicating disapproval, displeasure, or concentration. [noun] an expression of this type

lexUnit.name: expression.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the look on someone's face, seen as conveying a particular emotion.

lexUnit.name: smirk.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a smug or silly smile.

lexUnit.name: rictus.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fixed grimace or grin.

lexUnit.name: look.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an expression of a feeling or thought by such an act [of looking].

lexUnit.name: scowl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an angry or bad-tempered expression.

lexUnit.name: face.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an expression on someone's face.

lexUnit.name: snarl.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an act or sound of snarling [growling with bared teeth], quite often used for the bared-teeth configuration of the lips alone.

lexUnit.name: sneer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a contemptuous or mocking smile, remark, or tone (in this frame, only the facial expression.)

lexUnit.name: pout.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pouting expression; (i.e. push[ing] one's lips or bottom lip forward as an expression of petulant annoyance or in order to make oneself look sexually attractive).
